site_name: Triple R Farms Hattiesburg, LLC Carmen & Miles Smith

citations.narrative:
The outdoor enclosure housing two adult common marmosets is not completely enclosed by a perimeter fence. A
perimeter fence is important for preventing unauthorized people and animals from having contact with the nonhuman
primates, and acts as a secondary containment system if an animal escapes. Correct by ensuring that all outdoor non-
human primate enclosures are within a perimeter fence that is at least 6-feet tall and 3-feet away from the animal
enclosures.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
An environmental enrichment plan was not documented for the nonhuman primates at the facility (2 adult common
marmosets). Nonhuman primates have many complex social and environmental needs. Failure to provide opportunities
for social and environmental activities may result in boredom, stress, inactivity, weight gain, and may contribute to the
development of abnormal or harmful behaviors. Correct by documenting an enrichment plan for nonhuman primates at
the facility which addresses social and environmental enrichment for the nonhuman primates. The plan must also be
approved by the attending veterinarian.

Enclosures housing various exotic animals including otter, kangaroo, and porcupine are not entirely enclosed by a
perimeter fence. A perimeter fence is important for preventing unauthorized people or animals from having contact with
the exotic animals, and acts as a secondary containment system if an animal escapes. Correct by ensuring that all
outdoor exotic animal enclosures are within a perimeter fence that is at least 6-feet tall and 3-feet away from the animal
enclosures.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 16, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
3.78(d) 
   
Outdoor housing facilities. 
The outdoor enclosure housing two adult common marmosets is not completely enclosed by a perimeter fence. A 
perimeter fence is important for preventing unauthorized people and animals from having contact with the nonhuman 
primates, and acts as a secondary containment system if an animal escapes. Correct by ensuring that all outdoor non-
human primate enclosures are within a perimeter fence that is at least 6-feet tall and 3-feet away from the animal 
enclosures. 
3.81 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
An environmental enrichment plan was not documented for the nonhuman primates at the facility (2 adult common 
marmosets). Nonhuman primates have many complex social and environmental needs. Failure to provide opportunities 
for social and environmental activities may result in boredom, stress, inactivity, weight gain, and may contribute to the 
development of abnormal or harmful behaviors. Correct by documenting an enrichment plan for nonhuman primates at 
the facility which addresses social and environmental enrichment for the nonhuman primates. The plan must also be 
approved by the attending veterinarian. 
3.127(d) 
   
Facilities, outdoor. 
Enclosures housing various exotic animals including otter, kangaroo, and porcupine are not entirely enclosed by a 
perimeter fence. A perimeter fence is important for preventing unauthorized people or animals from having contact with 
the exotic animals, and acts as a secondary containment system if an animal escapes. Correct by ensuring that all 
outdoor exotic animal enclosures are within a perimeter fence that is at least 6-feet tall and 3-feet away from the animal 
enclosures. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant.

All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by September 16, 2023 or the applicant will forfeit the license 
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n

species.common: DOMESTIC PIG / POTBELLY PIG / MICRO PIG
